Gay USA, Vol. XVI, Episode No. 2
[Air date: 1/15/1998], January 1998

31142054869154box: 4, media: ID: 231.0052 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine

2. Interview: Maura Bairley, Community Organizer with the Gay and Lesbian Anti-Violence Project, discusses the disappearance of Cosmetica, AKA Cosmo or Freddie Messina.

COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra (HX), "The one. The only. The original."

3. AIDS News

COMMERCIAL: CDC National AIDS Hotline, PSA for providing food for homebound people with AIDS

4. Interview: Jonathan Lee, of the Maine SpeakOut Project, discusses the Maine anti-discrimination law and right-wing opposition.

5. Entertainment

COMMERCIAL: National Foundation for Infectious Diseases, C. Everett Koop, PSA for Hepatitis A

6. Interview: Mark Milano, of ACT UP New York, discusses recent HIV drug trials.

7. Lou Maletta interviews Robert E. Penn, author, regarding his book "The Gay Men's Wellness Guide".

31142054869154box: 4, media: ID: 231.0053 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

COMMERCIAL: Blue Ball "Come to Life" event in Philadelphia to benefit AIDS Information Network

2. AIDS News

COMMERCIAL: CDC National Aids Hotline, "When I Grow Up"

3. Interview: Ronald Johnson, of the Gay Men's Health Crisis (GMHC), discusses the name-based reporting of HIV-related information.

COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra (HX), "The one. The only. The original."

4. Lou Maletta interviews Robert E. Penn, author, regarding his book "The Gay Men's Wellness Guide".

COMMERCIAL: Blue Ball "Come to Life" event in Philadelphia to benefit AIDS Information Network

5. Entertainment

COMMERCIAL: National Foundation for Infectious Diseases, C. Everett Koop, PSA for Hepatitis A

6. Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund presents "The Lambda Update", with Kevin Cathcart, Executive Director, and Suzanne Goldberg, Staff Attorney.

COMMERCIAL: Blue Ball "Come to Life" event in Philadelphia to benefit AIDS Information Network

7. Clip from "Speak Out!" video by [Ellen Spiro].

31142054869154box: 4, media: ID: 231.0054 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

COMMERCIAL: Blue Ball "Come to Life" event in Philadelphia to benefit AIDS Information Network

2. Interview: Michael Swirsky, of ACT UP New York, discusses the name-based reporting of HIV-related information.

COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra (HX), "The one. The only. The original."

COMMERCIAL: Elizabeth Taylor for AmFAR, "Don't make it five thousand and one"

3. AIDS News

COMMERCIAL: Cable Positive, "AIDS is not over"

5. Entertainment

[Air date: 1/28/1998]: January 1998

Gay USA, Vol. XVI, Episode No. 5
[Air date: 2/5/1998], February 1998

31142054869154box: 4, media: ID: 231.0055 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra (HX), "The one. The only. The original."

COMMERCIAL: Cable Positive, "AIDS is not over"

2. Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund presents "The Lambda Update", with Beatrice Dohrn, Legal Director, and David Buckel, Staff Attorney.

COMMERCIAL: National Foundation for Infectious Diseases, C. Everett Koop, PSA for Hepatitis A

3. AIDS News. Includes footage of ACT UP demonstration against Gay Men's Health Crisis (GMHC).

COMMERCIAL: CDC National AIDS Hotline, PSA for providing food for homebound people with AIDS

4. Entertainment, includes promo for "Crossings", a lesbian romantic comedy play by Barbara Kahn.

Conditions Governing Access

Currently available.

Gay USA, Vol. XVI, Episode No. 6
[Air date: 2/12/1998], February 1998

31142054869154box: 4, media: ID: 231.0056 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra (HX), "The one. The only. The original."

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

COMMERCIAL: Cable Positive, "AIDS is not over"

2. Interview: Matt Foreman, Executive Director of Empire State Pride Agenda, discusses political issues affecting the LGBT community.

COMMERCIAL: National Foundation for Infectious Diseases, C. Everett Koop, PSA for Hepatitis A

3. AIDS News

COMMERCIAL: Elizabeth Taylor for AmFAR, "Don't make it five thousand and one"

4. Entertainment

COMMERCIAL: Lesbian and Gay Public Awareness Project, tells the story of Bobby Griffith

5. Lou Maletta interviews Perry Brass, author, regarding his books "The Harvest" and "The Lover of My Soul".

31142054869154box: 4, media: ID: 231.0057 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

COMMERCIAL: National Foundation for Infectious Diseases, C. Everett Koop, PSA for Hepatitis A

2. AIDS News

3. Fox News footage of "Surgeon General Swearing In Ceremony" for David Satcher.

COMMERCIAL: Elizabeth Taylor for AmFAR, "Don't make it five thousand and one"

4. Andrew Taines interviews Jeffrey Solomon, playwright and actor, regarding his play "Mother/Son". Includes Solomon performing the part of Mother.

COMMERCIAL: Lesbian and Gay Public Awareness Project, tells the story of Bobby Griffith

5. Entertainment

6. Lou Maletta interviews Christopher Bradley, actor, regarding the film "Leather Jacket Love Story," in which Bradley stars. Includes film footage.

2. Interview: Fran DeBenedictis, Executive Director of the Gay Officers Action League (GOAL), and Susan O'Brien, member of the Irish Lesbian and Gay Organization (ILGO), discuss St. Patrick's Day events.

3. AIDS News

4. Entertainment

5. Clip from Tracey Ullman's show ["Tracey Takes On…"]. Includes introduction by Andy Humm.

3. AIDS News

4. Lou Maletta interviews Dean LaBate, Executive Director of Callen – Lorde Community Health Center, regarding the organization's new facility. Includes Maletta touring the facility.

5. Entertainment

Scope and Content

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

31142054869154box: 4, media: ID: 231.0064 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra (HX), "The one. The only. The original."

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

COMMERCIAL: National Foundation for Infectious Diseases, C. Everett Koop, PSA for Hepatitis A

2. Interview: Steve Cozza, founder of Scouting for All, and Sergeant Edgar Rodriguez, President of the Gay Officers Action League (GOAL), discuss Scouting For All, an organization created by Cozza in response to discrimination from the Boy Scouts of America, as well as the GOAL annual dinner in which Cozza will be honored.

COMMERCIAL: CDC National AIDS Hotline, PSA for providing food for homebound people with AIDS

3. AIDS News

4. Entertainment

5. Nora Burns discusses recent nightlife and entertainment-related events that relate to the LGBT community.

6. Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund presents "The Lambda Update", with Kevin Cathcart, Executive Director, and Heather Sawyer, Staff Attorney, Midwest Region.

COMMERCIAL: Lesbian and Gay Public Awareness Project, tells the story of Bobby Griffith

31142054869162box: 5, media: ID: 231.0066 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra (HX), "The one. The only. The original."

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

2. Footage of Reggie White on ABC's 20/20 regarding his controversial comments on homosexuality.

COMMERCIAL: Out on the Edge Together Festival '98

3. AIDS News

4. Entertainment, includes special celebration for Ann Northrop's 50th birthday.

5. Andrew Taines interviews Scott Dobbins, Co-Executive Producer of the Out on the Edge Together Festival, regarding the festival.

6. Interview: Marvin Schwam, of Gay Entertainment Television (GET), discusses GET's going public.

7. Nora Burns discusses recent nightlife and entertainment-related events that relate to the LGBT community.

8. Interview: Terry Kaelber, Executive Director of Senior Action in a Gay Environment (SAGE), and Madelin Alk, Vice President of SAGE, discuss the first national conference on aging in the LGBT community.

COMMERCIAL: Out on the Edge Together Festival '98

9. Footage of Walter Schubert, CEO of the Gay Financial Network (GFN), speaking at the Launch Party for GFN.

31142054869162box: 5, media: ID: 231.0069 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra (HX), "The one. The only. The original."

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

2. Footage from NY1 of Cardinal John Joseph O'Connor denouncing proposed domestic partner benefits legislation.

COMMERCIAL: National Foundation for Infectious Diseases, C. Everett Koop, PSA for Hepatitis A

3. Interview: Steve Ault and Leslie Cagan, activists, discuss the Millennium March on Washington.

COMMERCIAL: National AIDS Hotline, "Protect your kids from AIDS. Talk with them about sex".

4. AIDS News

COMMERCIAL: National AIDS Hotline, "Isn't it time you talked with your kids?" Features Kerry Carson, activist.

5. Interview: Dennis Beauchemin, victim of bias crime, discusses his assault.

COMMERCIAL: National AIDS Hotline, "Carry the torch. Talk about AIDS."

6. Entertainment

COMMERCIAL: National AIDS Hotline, "Make the effort. Talk about sex. Protect your kids from AIDS".

7. Footage from the 20th Annual International Mr. Leather contest.

Gay USA, Vol. XVI, Episode No. 27
[Air date: 7/2/1998], July 1998

31142054869162box: 5, media: ID: 231.0073 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra (HX), "The one. The only. The original."

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

2. Footage from CSPAN regarding the "Legal Age of Homosexual Consent" in the United Kingdom.

3. Footage of Pride Month event in which Mark Green, [politician], honors activists at City Hall. Includes footage of Harry Bartel and Brian Landeche, owners of Splash bar; Craig Lucas, playwright; and Betty Santoro, member of Lesbian Feminist Liberation.

4. Footage of activists protesting the mayor's participation in the Lesbian and Gay Pride March.

5. AIDS News

6. Interview: James LaRocca, candidate for the Democratic primary for Governor of New York, discusses his political platform with respect to LGBT issues.

7. Footage of Tom of Finland at the Manhunt Party.

8. Nora Burns discusses recent nightlife and entertainment-related events that relate to the LGBT community.

9. Entertainment

10. Footage of the 1998 Gay and Lesbian Pride Parade. Includes footage of NYC politicians Margarita Lopez, Peter Vallone, Rudy Giuliani, Alan Hevesi, and Mark Green.

11. Footage of Pier Dance.

5. Nora Burns discusses recent nightlife and entertainment-related events that relate to the LGBT community.

6. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop wish Lou Maletta a happy 62nd birthday. Includes clip of George Michael's music video for his single "Outside".

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

31142054869139box: 2, media: ID: 231.0021 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

2. Interview: Norman Laurila, owner of A Different Light, discusses the issues facing his small LGBT bookstore.

3. AIDS News

4. Interview: Joan Egan, Interviewer, and Lucy Winer, Director, discuss their documentary "Golden Threads". Includes film footage.

5. Entertainment

Conditions Governing Access

Currently available.

Gay USA, Vol. XVII, Episode No. 22
[Air date: 6/3/1999], June 1999

31142054869139box: 2, media: ID: 231.0022 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

2. Interview: Sandra Gonzalez, co-producer, discusses her documentary "The Lesbian & Gay Big Apple Corps: We're the Marching Band Your Mother Warned You About". Includes film footage.

3. AIDS News

4. Laren Lambdin discusses the International Mr. Leather contest. Includes event footage.

5. Laren Lambdin interviews John Weis, chairman of Gay-Male-S/M Activists (GMSMA), regarding the Folsom Street East block party.

6. Entertainment

Gay USA, Vol. XVII, Episode No. 23
[Air date: 6/10/1999], June 1999

31142054869139box: 2, media: ID: 231.0023 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

2. Footage of Lou Maletta receiving award from All Out Arts Foundation.

3. AIDS News

4. Interview: Linda Chapman and Lola Pashalinski, writers and actresses, discuss their play "Gertrude and Alice".

5. Entertainment

6. Interview: Andrew Taines, theatre critic, and Shep Wahnon, LGBT activist, discuss attending Gay Days at Disney.

7. Lou Maletta interviews Elaine St. George, vocalist, regarding the show "The Girl That I Marry."

31142054869139box: 2, media: ID: 231.0024 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

2. Footage from CNN of Vice President Al Gore in Carthage, Tennessee to announce his candidacy for President.

3. AIDS News

4. Entertainment

5. Interview: Kathy Abundanzo and Ken Majerus, of Front Runners New York, discuss the 18th annual Lesbian & Gay Pride Run.

6. Lou Maletta interviews Michael Picucci, author, regarding his book "The Journey Toward Complete Recovery".

Gay USA, Vol. XVII, Episode No. 26
[Air date: 7/1/1999], July 1999

31142054869139box: 2, media: ID: 231.0026 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

2. Interview: Richard Spedale and Brian Thornton, who shared the first live gay kiss on national television, discuss the event. Includes footage from the NBC Today Show.

3. Footage of the New York Pride March. Includes interviews with Mayor Rudy Giuliani and politician Christopher Lynn.

4. AIDS News

5. Entertainment

6. Nora Burns discusses recent nightlife and entertainment-related events that relate to the LGBT community.

7. Lou Maletta interviews [curator] of the Jim French: Masc. exhibit at the Wessel-O'Conner Gallery.

31142054869139box: 2, media: ID: 231.0028 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

2. Interview: Robert Vazquez, of the Audre Lorde Project, discusses the case involving Christian Curry's firing from Morgan Stanley.

3. Footage of [Al Sharpton] discussing the Christian Curry case.

4. AIDS News

5. Entertainment

COMMERCIAL: preview for the film "Drop Dead Gorgeous".

6. Interview: Simon Callow, actor, director, and author, discusses his book "Love Is Where It Falls".

7. Lou Maletta interviews Michael Picucci, author, regarding his book "The Journey Toward Complete Recovery".

8. Nora Burns discusses recent nightlife and entertainment-related events that relate to the LGBT community.

Gay USA, Vol. XVII, Episode No. 35
[Air date: 9/2/1999], September 1999

31142054869147box: 3, media: ID: 231.0033 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

2. Footage from NY1 of Fed Up Queers protesting Rudy Giuliani as the keynote speaker at the Log Cabin Republicans convention, resulting in security guards beating and bloodying several activists.

3. Interview: Ed Anderson discusses the Log Cabin Republicans.

4. Lesbian and Gay News

5. AIDS News

6. Entertainment

7. Interview: Evan Wolfson, of the LAMBDA Legal Defense and Education Fund, discusses political and legal issues affecting the LGBT community.

8. Interview: Tom Duane, NYS Senator, discusses political issues affecting the LGBT community, including the Fed Up Queers protest against the Log Cabin Republicans.

Scope and Content

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

2. AIDS News

3. Interview: Martha Fugate, Director of Project Y.E.S., a program that promotes safe schools and healthy families, discusses taking her Miami-based organization nationally.

4. Interview: Dot Staruch and Richard Rogers, of the dance committee of Senior Action in a Gay Environment (SAGE), discuss upcoming LGBT dances.

5. Entertainment

6. Clip from "Will and Grace" season opener.

31142054869147box: 3, media: ID: 231.0038 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

2. Footage of Andy Humm at George W. Bush presidential fundraiser and protest.

3. Lesbian and Gay News

4. Interview: Deborah Glick, NYS Assembly Member, discusses political issues affecting the LGBT community.

5. Footage of Andy Humm interviewing Eric Sawyer of AIDS Drugs for Africa and ACT UP at a George W. Bush protest.

6. Entertainment

7. Interview: Deborah Glick, NYS Assembly Member, continues her discussion of political issues affecting the LGBT community.

Gay USA, Vol. XVII, Episode No. [40]
[Air date: 10/14/1999], October 1999

31142054869147box: 3, media: ID: 231.0039 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

2. Footage of Bill Clinton at the Empire State Pride Agenda dinner discussing political issues affecting the LGBT community.

3. Footage of Andy Humm interviewing attendees at the Empire State Pride Agenda dinner.

4. Lesbian and Gay News

5. Interview: Howie Katz, Director of the New York regional office of the Anti-Defamation League, discusses hate crimes legislation.

6. AIDS News

7. Interview: John Catania and Desireena Almoradie, Producers of "In the Life", discuss the evolution and significance of their show.

8. Entertainment

9. Nora Burns discusses recent nightlife and entertainment-related events that relate to the LGBT community.

10. Clip from "Queer As Folk" of two gay men kissing; Lou Maletta discusses the significance of this clip.

Gay USA, Vol. XVII, Episode No. 41
[Air date: 10/21/1999], October 1999

31142054869147box: 3, media: ID: 231.0040 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

2. Footage from C-SPAN of Janet Reno, Attorney General, at the Human Rights Campaign Annual Dinner discussing hate crimes.

3. Footage from C-SPAN of Judy Shepard, mother of Matthew Shepard, at the Human Rights Campaign Annual Dinner. Includes Human Rights Campaign commercial featuring Judy Shepard.

4. Footage from C-Span of Martina Navratilova, civil rights activist and former professional tennis player, at the Human Rights Campaign Annual Dinner, receiving the National Equality Award.

5. AIDS News

6. Entertainment

7. Lou Maletta discusses male and female reproductive systems.

8. Footage from Matthew Shepard political funeral.

3. AIDS News

Scope and Content

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

2. Footage of Quentin Crisp discussing American cinema.

3. Interview: Hal Kooden, of the International Lesbian and Gay Association, discusses international political issues affecting the LGBT community.

5. AIDS News

6. Entertainment

7. Lou Maletta discusses Thanksgiving.

[Air date: 11/25/1999]: November 1999

Gay USA, Vol. XVII, Episode No. 47
[Air date: 12/2/1999], December 1999

31142054869147box: 3, media: ID: 231.0046 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

2. Footage of World AIDS Day banner at the Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel.

3. Footage of Housing Works annual march to City Hall.

4. Lou Maletta interviews Dr. Gabriel Torres, regarding his program to provide prophylaxis for AIDS victims and their partners.

5. Interview: John Wallowitch, composer and pianist, discusses the documentary regarding his life with partner Bertram Ross. Includes film footage.

COMMERCIAL: National Foundation for Infectious Diseases, C. Everett Koop, PSA for Hepatitis A

6. Entertainment

Conditions Governing Access

Currently available.

Gay USA, Vol. XVII, Episode No. 48
[Air date: 12/9/1999], December 1999

31142054869147box: 3, media: ID: 231.0047 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

2. Footage of Connie Chung's interview with Steven Mullins regarding the murder of Billy Jack Gaither, for which Mullins and Charles Monroe Butler were convicted.

3. Interview: Grant Lukenbill, author and consultant, discusses Exxon's cancellation of domestic partner benefits.

4. AIDS News

5. Interview: William Trafka, Music Director at St. Bartholomew's Church, discusses the church's annual event "A Joyous Christmas Concert".

6. Entertainment

7. Lou Maletta interviews Joseph Cohen, author, regarding his book "The Penis Book".

COMMERCIAL: AIDS Project Los Angeles, "There's life after sex."

Gay USA, Vol. XVII, Episode No. 49
[Air date: 12/16/1999], December 1999

31142054869147box: 3, media: ID: 231.0048 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

2. Footage of ACT UP's "Stop the Church" protest, including speeches by Kate Barnhart of YELL and Ann Northrop of ACT UP New York.

3. Interview: Edward Stein, PhD, author, discusses his book "The Mismeasure of Desire".

4. Entertainment, includes Nora Burns discussing recent nightlife and entertainment-related events that relate to the LGBT community.

Gay USA, Vol. XVII, Episode No. 50
[Air date: 12/23/1999], December 1999

31142054869154box: 4, media: ID: 231.0049 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

1. Footage from NBC Channel 4 News regarding gay marriage in Vermont and New York.

2. Interview: Evan Wolfson, of the Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund, discusses the gay marriage case in Vermont and other states.

COMMERCIAL: Gay Men's Health Crisis (GMHC), featuring Queen Latifah and [Kim Coles], "Fight the Fear"

3. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

4. Interview: Ann Duggan, of the Irish Lesbian and Gay Organization (ILGO), discusses Hilary Clinton and the St. Patrick's Day Parade.

5. AIDS News

COMMERCIAL: AIDS Project Los Angeles, "We Lose"

6. [Entertainment]

7. Nora Burns discusses nightlife and recent entertainment-related events that relate to the LGBT community.

COMMERCIAL: National AIDS Hotline

COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra (HX), "The one. The only. The original."

COMMERCIAL: Prototypes, featuring Queen Latifah

COMMERCIAL: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), "America Responds to AIDS"

COMMERCIAL: Urban AID 4 Lifebeat, "The Music Industry Fights AIDS"

Gay USA, Vol. XVIII, Episode No. 5
[Air date: 2/3/2000], February 2000

31142054869428box: 31, media: ID: 231.0493 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

COMMERCIAL: 7th International Gay and Lesbian 2000 Business and Entertainment Festival

2. AIDS News

3. Lou Maletta interviews Monika Treut, Director of "Gendernauts: A Journey Through Shifting Identities", regarding her film.

COMMERCIAL: 7th International Gay and Lesbian 2000 Business and Entertainment Festival

4. [Entertainment]

5. Lou Maletta reflects on the movement within the gay movement of gays and lesbians striving to be assimilated into straight culture.

Gay USA, Vol. XVIII, Episode No. 6
[Air date: 2/10/2000], February 2000

31142054869428box: 31, media: ID: 231.0494 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

2. Interview: Emmaia Gelman, of the Irish Lesbian and Gay Organization (ILGO), and Brendan Fay, [Founder] of the Lavender and Green Alliance, discuss their groups' previous and upcoming efforts and events.

COMMERCIAL: 7th International Gay and Lesbian 2000 Business and Entertainment Festival

3. AIDS News

4. Interview: Peter Webb, co-author of musical play "Splendora", and Mark Cortale, actor in musical, discuss the show.

COMMERCIAL: 7th International Gay and Lesbian 2000 Business and Entertainment Festival

5. Entertainment

6. Clip from Monika Treut's film "Gendernauts".

7. Lou Maletta discusses his upcoming presentation at the Community Center regarding the history and importance of gay cable. Maletta also mentions that they have 6000 videos in their archive which will be digitized and eventually put on the Internet for people to see.

Titles and program content have been transcribed from original container annotations. These tapes have not been viewed by an archivist.

Series XXII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff, 1985-1990

1984

[1]--Pride and Progress. Episode No. 1 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 118
[Air Date: 10/4/1984], October 1984

31142054869501box: 39, media: ID: 231.0599 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News - highlights:
1. Massachusetts Congressman Gary Studds, openly gay, wins primary victory; Interview with David Bender of the Studds campaign
COMMERCIAL: "Badlands," NYC gay bar
2. Sports report
3. Federal government requests AIDS funding
4. Rutgers University offers "Homosexuality in Society" course
5. FBI files on gay organizations released
6. Referendum to repeal gay rights in Maryland
7. Human Rights Commission: gay and lesbian discrimination documentation project; interview with Katy Taylor
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionals
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native"
8. Three teens charged in death of Charles Howard, a gay man in Maine
9. Interview with Vivian Shapiro, Human Rights Campaign
COMMERCIAL: "The Connect"
Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Dr. Steven Caiazza discusses "How to Reduce Risk of Getting AIDS"
COMMERCIAL: World of Video
The Right Stuff:
COMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity with Abigail "Dear Abby" Van Buren
COMMERCIAL: Pensione, San Francisco Hotel
1. Interview with Phyllis Diller, entertainer
COMMERCIAL: H. Clay Friedrichs Realtors, New Jersey
COMMERCIAL: Rio Adventure, Orpheo travel agency
2."Brothers," a Showtime cable comedy series
COMMERCIAL: "People in Touch," a gay dating service
3. "Fever of an Unknown Origin" - Interviews with actor playwright Stephen Holt, actor Raymie Priesmeyer, scenes from the play
COMMERCIAL: World of Video
COMMERCIAL: Spur Productions
4. Phyllis Diller interview/ closing credits
COMMERCIAL National Fund for Human Dignity with Judge Steven Lax

Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements

Duration: 01:00:00
Format: 3/4 in. Umatic

Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements

Duration: 01:00:00
Original Format: 3/4 in. Umatic

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 3 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 120
[Air Date: 10/13/1984], October 1984

31142054869501box: 39, media: ID: 231.0602 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News - highlights:
1. Sentencing of Maine teens in death of Charles Howard, a gay man
2. San Francisco rejects extending employment benefits to gay partners of city workers
3. First Ronald Reagan versus Walter Mondale debate viewed by gay Mondale supporters
COMMERCIAL: "Badlands," NYC gay bar
4. Sports Report
5. Interview with Ivan [Deeds] about Gay Narcotics Anonymous
6. Sweden as a place for political asylum for gays
7. Sentencing of Gary Lee Hopper, a male hustler, in slashing and attempted robbery of gay man
8. Gay center opens in Allentown, Pennsylvania
9. Interview with Peter Vogel, Chairperson for New York Gay Task Force
COMMERCIAL: Rio Adventure, Orpheo travel agency
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionals
10. Interview with Peter Guardino, Gay Police Officers Action League
11. Proposal to make West Hollywood a city
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native"
Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Dr. Scott Croxson, Fellow Immunopathology, discusses HTLV virus
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," a gay newspaper The Right Stuff:
COMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity with actor Mike Farrell
1. Footage from San Francisco memorial for John Simms, who passed away from AIDS
COMMERCIAL: H. Clay Friedrichs Realtors, New Jersey
COMMERCIAL: Rio Adventure, Orpheo travel agency
2.Interview with director Robert Epstein, producer Richard Schmiechen, and publicist Vito Russo, "The Times of Harvey Milk"
COMMERCIAL: Pensione, San Francisco Hotel
COMMERCIAL: Spur Productions
3. "Swan in Love," commentary and clips about motion picture
COMMERCIAL National Fund for Human Dignity with actor Jack Albertson
COMMERCIAL: World of Video
4. More from interviews about "The Times of Harvey Milk"/ closing credits

Original Format: 3/4 in. Umatic

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 6 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 123
[Air Date: 11/6/1984], November 1984

31142054869501box: 39, media: ID: 231.0605 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News - highlights:
1. New York Executive Order #50 - a non-discrimination policy on city contactors
2. Interview with Willy Smith, Gay and Lesbian Inter-Religious Coalition
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native," with Quentin Crisp
3. Interview with Nancy Roth, executive director of Gay Rights National Lobby, Washington D.C.
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, Career Service Professionals
4. AIDS fears in court
5. Interview with Tim Sweeney, director of LAMBDA Legal Defense, discussing LAMBDA's AIDS Legal Guide
COMMERCIAL: "Rome Adventure," Orpheo Travel Agency
6. Interview with Reverend Karen Zeigler, director of Metropolitan Community Church, discussing their on-going application to the National Council of Churches
COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
7. Gay and lesbian child custody announcement
8. LAMBDA Democrats, authors night
COMMERCIAL: Arcos Blancos Resort, San Juan, Puerto Rico
9. Heathline: Conversations with GMHC: Dr. Jeffrey Lawrence, NY Hospital, Cornell Medical Center, discusses new directions in treating AIDS
COMMERCIAL: "Badlands," NYC gay bar
10. Sports Report: Interview with Jim Link and Leslie Randolph, Rambler Soccer Club The Right Stuff:
1. 1984 Halloween on Christopher Street, NYC
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay/lesbian newspaper
2. Lo Nardo, music group, performing
COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
3. Broadway star Vivian Blaine performing "live" at SAGE Benefit at the Limelight, NYC. Songs: "Guys and Dolls medley"
COMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity with Abigail "Dear Abby" Van Buren
4. Media Report: "Hollywood Babylon II," Japanese condoms, Cardinal Spellman, Michael Musto receives Village Voice column
COMMERCIAL: Spur Production
5. 1984 Halloween coverage/ Closing credits

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 9 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 126
[Air Date: 11/27/1984], November 1984

31142054869501box: 39, media: ID: 231.0608 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News - highlights:
1. Interview with Nancy Roth, Executive Director, Gay Rights National Lobby, discussing anti-discrimination in immigration policy
COMMERCIAL: Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro, Islanders' Club
2. City status granted to West Hollywood, California; city council is formed
3. Anti-gay Texas Senator Phil [Graham] wins election
4. Gay Rights bill passed in Houston, Texas, but may be overturned
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
5. Interview with David Bender, campaigner, discussing the win of Massachusetts' openly gay Senator Gary Studds
COMMERCIAL: New York Gay Film Festival
6. National Gay Task Force meeting
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
7. Interview with Pastor Karen Zeigler, Metropolitan Community Church, discusses meeting with National Council of Churches
COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
8. First census of a gay community, San Francisco
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionals
9. Carol Bellamy, announcement of upcoming appearance
COMMERCIAL: Arcos Blancos, San Juan, Puerto Rico
10. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Christopher Collins, attorney, discusses the start of Community Health Project
COMMERCIAL: "Badlands," a NYC gay bar
11. Sports Report/ closing The Right Stuff:
1. Media Report/ Current Events
COMMERCIAL: Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro, Islanders' Club
2. Terry Miller interviews Quentin Crisp, author/ performer
COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
3. Quentin Crisp interview continued
COMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity for disabled gays and lesbians
4. Preview of upcoming gay motion picture, "Whispers"
COMMERCIAL: Rio Adventure, Orpheo travel agency
5. Interview with Ron Gould, producer of gay film "Whispers"/ closing credits

Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News - highlights:
1. "Black and White Men Together" members Lidell Jackson and Mitchell Karp discuss racial discrimination at the Ice Palace
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
2. National Gay Task Force, interviews with members Peter Fowler and Evelyn White
COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
3. Interview with Keith O'Connor, NYC Human Rights Commission, discussing anti-gay discrimination bill in NYC
COMMERCIAL: Carnaval in Rio de Janiero, The Islanders Club
4. Report on Executive Order 50; employment rights for city contractors
COMMERCIAL: New York Gay Film Festival
5. U.S. Court of Appeals for District of Columbia refused to hear case of expelled gay navy officer
6. Community announcements
COMMERCIAL: Arco Blancos resort, San Juan, Puerto Rico
7. Heathline: Conversations with GMHC: Topic: AIDS Assessment Program of Community Health Project. Interview with Dr. Ted Lazarus, clinical coordinator AIDS Assessment Program, and Rona Affoumado, Admin. Director, Community Health Project
COMMERCIAL: Badlands, NYC gay bar
8. Sports report The Right Stuff:
1. Current Events
COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
COMMERCIAL: World of Video
2. Interview with Gary Miller, music director of the NYC Gay Men's Chorus, includes footage of chorus performing at Christopher Street Liberation Day Parade 1984
COMMERCIAL: New York Gay and Lesbian Film Festival
COMMERCIAL: NGTF Fund for Human Dignity: gay and lesbian disabled
4. Interview with Quentin Crisp

Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News - highlights:
1. Nancy Roth, executive director of Gay Rights National Lobby, discusses history of National Gay Rights Bill

2. [Greg Merkus] discusses upcoming Winter Solstice fundraiser at the new Community Center
3. Dr. Mervin Silverman talks to New York Physicians For Human Rights discussing his concerns over the re-opening of bathhouses in San Francisco

4. "Black and White Men Together" members Lidell Jackson and Mitchell Karp discuss racial discrimination
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp

Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News - highlights:
1. A recap of some of the major LGBT events of 1984. Clips include:
2. Original "Stonewallers" at Pride Parade
3. Bella Abzug speech at Greater Gotham Business Meeting
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
4. Virginia Apuzzo on LGBT presence at Democratic National Convention
5. VP candidate Geraldine Ferraro at Democratic National Convention on human rights
6. Maureen Reagan, daughter of President, interviewed at Republican National Convention
COMMERCIAL: Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro, Islanders' Club
7. Mayor Ed Koch at fundraiser for Judge Bill Thom
8. David Rothenberg campaign speech
10. Speech by Victor Gotbaum, Director DC 37, AFSCME
COMMERCIAL: World of Video
11. [Fairpack], a new political gay action committee
12. Reports on AIDS in 1984
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionals
13. Report on gays on television in 1984, including Showtime's cable series "Brothers"
14. Gay youth
16. Acquisition of NYC's LGBT Community Center on West 13th Street
15. Wrap up of 1984 events
COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store
16. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Michael Shernoff, Chelsea Psychotherapy, discusses how to deal with friends who have AIDS
17. Closing credits The Right Stuff:
1. Performance by the Big Apple Corps Band with the Pink Panther
COMMERCIAL: "The Gascon," a novel by John Colin Penford
2. Gary Dee, female impersonator, on playing Joan Rivers
COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store
3. "Home for the Holidays," benefit at Limelight for AIDS Research Center (ARC), appearances by Whoopi Goldberg, Maurice Hines
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
4. "Impulse," Gat TV in Atlanta
COMMERCIAL: World of Video
5. Closing Credits

6. Latest on gays and religion

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 19 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 136
[Air Date: 2/5/1985], February 1985

31142054869519box: 40, media: ID: 231.0618 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News - highlights:
1. Virginia Supreme Court child custody suit
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionals
2. Tom Stoddard, Legislative Director of New York Civil Liberties Union, on legality of gay relationships
3. Federal Gay Rights Bill reintroduced in U.S. House of Representatives
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
4. Interview with Jeff Snow and Bonnie McGinley, spokepersons for Concerned Americans for Individual Rights
5. The American Automobile Association in Wisconsin extends its benefits to gay couples
6. Salvation Army in Wisconsin loses contract when it refuses to sign anti-discrimination clause
7. Andy Humm discusses anti-gay rights activist, John J. O'Connor, Catholic Archbishop of New York
COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store
8. Interview with Brent Nicholson, head of The American Run for the End of AIDS
9. Sports Report
COMMERCIAL: Actor/ playwright Harvey Fierstein announces his return to "Torch Song Trilogy" at the Helen Hayes Theatre
10. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Elaine Noble, Addiction Recovery Corp. member, discusses alcohol and drug addiction in the gay community
11. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Media reports/current events
COMMERCIAL: "The Gascon," a novel by John Colin Penford
2. Valentine's Day edition of "Season's Eatings" with Joe Alleva
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazine
3. Interview with Robert Rios, director of Dallas production of "Boys in the Band"
COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store
3. On the Streets with Jon
4. Closing credits

Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. New chairman of Democratic Party, Paul G. Kirk Junior, approves the removal of the caucus system, a gay/lesbian political conduit
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionals
2. Interview with Jeff Snow and Bonnie McGinley, spokepersons for Concerned Americans for Individual Rights
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
3. Philadelphia Commission on Human Relations/military Recruitment Conflict at Temple University
4. Gay employment rights referendum does not pass in Houston, Texas, interview with Debra Danbury, state representative of Houston District #137
COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
5. 5th circuit of appeals reviews sodomy law that only includes homosexuals in Austin, Texas
6. Openly gay and closeted politicians

COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store
7. Sports
8. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Interview with Joyce Hunter, Program Director at Institute For the Protection of Lesbian & Gay Youth, discusses shelters and counseling

4. Interview with The Women of Dallas

5. On the streets with John Seidner
6. Closing credits

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 21 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 138
[Air Date: 2/18/1985], February 1985

31142054869519box: 40, media: ID: 231.0620 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Virginia Apuzzo resigns from National Gay Task Force
2. Virginia Apuzzo gives speech at press conference
COMMERCIAL: Actor/ playwright Harvey Fierstein announces his return to "Torch Song Trilogy" at the Helen Hayes Theatre
3. Reagan administration drastically cuts AIDS funding in 1986 budget
4. French researchers develop new drug for AIDS treatment, HPA23
4. ABC movie "Consulting Adults", viewership ratings and clip from film
5. New Hampshire Bill proposes gay/lesbian blood donation as felony
6. School administrators cancel Tolerance Day in Madison, Maine, because of lesbian speaker
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
7. Commentary on LGBT civil rights
COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store
8. Texas State Legislature representative Bill Ceverha, author of proposed Texas sodomy law
9. West Hollywood and domestic partners ordinance
10. San Francisco City Civil Service Commission rejects Public Health department request to hire private investigators for gay bathhouses
11. "The Times of Harvey Milk" documentary acclaim
COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
12. Sports
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionals
13. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Interview with Michele Schwartz, Coordinator of Senior Action in a Gay Environment
14. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Sue Cavin, president of the Gay and Lesbian Press Association, discusses censorship in the New York Times
2. Media reports/current events/culture
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazine
3. Sybil Opthalmia Bruncheon takes ill
COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store
4. Cooking with Sybil Opthalmia Bruncheon
COMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity with Jack Albertson
5. Closing credits

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 22 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 139
[Air Date: 2/26/1985], February 1985

31142054869519box: 40, media: ID: 231.0621 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. HTLV testing delay and false positive rate
2. Gerry Studds regains chairmanship of the house subcommittee on coastguard and navigation
COMMERCIAL: "Lust in the Dust"
3. Kings County Council in Washington state proposes an updated anti-gay discrimination ban for employment
4. More on West Hollywood and domestic partners ordinance
5. More on school administrators cancel Tolerance Day in Madison, Maine, because of lesbian speaker
6. Commentary on Bernard Goetz, "subway vigilante"
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
7. Los Angeles Mayor Tom Bradley fails to appoint more high level positions to openly gay people and promises to do better if re-elected
8. Councilman John Goodner of Houston, Texas plans to challenge current pro-gay mayor, Kathy Whitmire
9. Sue Lovell becomes first female president of Houston's Gay Political caucus
10. Erie, Pennsylvania Judge questions validity of gay man's will, specifies nearly 120,000 dollar donation to further gay civil rights
10. Big Brother accepts any volunteers no matter his/her sexual orientation
COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store
11. Sports, interview with Tom Hull, commissioner of MCAA Big Apple Softball
12. Weather report
13. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Sara T. Beatrice, Chief of Virology Labs, New York City Department of Health, discusses HTLV 3 test
14. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Media reports/current events/culture
COMMERCIAL: "Lust in the Dust"
2. "Rags of the 80s" Fashion show footage at The Limelight
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazine
3. Interview with Dr. Jim Serafini on counseling both straight and gay men
COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store
4. Interview with William Hoffman and Marshall Mason, playwright and director of play "As Is"
5. Closing credits

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 22 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 139
[Air Date: 2/26/1985]: February 1985

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 23 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 140
[Air Date: 3/5/1985], March 1985

31142054869519box: 40, media: ID: 231.0622 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Update on Human Rights Commission documenting anti-gay discrimination
2. Interview with Keith O'Connor, Director of Discrimination for the NYC Human Rights Commission
COMMERCIAL: "Lust in the Dust"
3. Supreme court refuses to hear Ohio high school guidance counselor's gay discrimination case
4. National Gay Task Force Versus Oklahoma City schools
5. Baltimore city council members vote against gay civil rights (anti-discriminatory) law
6. Carol Bellamy, President of the New York City council, runs for mayor, includes clip of Bellamy at Greater Gotham Business Council
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
7. The Foundation For Traditional Morality blames rise in AIDS to overturned Dallas sodomy law
8. Local Dallas insurance agent misrepresents cancer plan to bar owners, says it includes AIDS, AIDS insurance plans
COMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity with Abigail "Dear Abby" Van Buren
9. Washing D.C. gay activists ask city to help fund AIDS education, counseling, and services
10. Reagan administration lacks AIDS funding support
11. Inter-faith Forum clip on Religion and AIDS
COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store
12. Sports
13. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Christopher Collins, Cooperating Attorney with LAMBDA Legal Defense and Education Fund, discusses HTLVIII test
14. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Media reports/current events/culture including Reagan rap and "Pleasure Beach" clip
[COMMERCIAL: "Lust in the Dust"]
2. Barbara Esposito and Bruce Hopkins start gay comedy night at Paper Moon, clips and outtakes
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazine
3. Interview with psychologist, Dr. Jim Serafini, discusses AIDS and sex fears

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 24 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 141
[Air Date: 3/12/1985], March 1985

31142054869519box: 40, media: ID: 231.0623 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Food and Drug Administration licenses HTLV III test amid doubts of its accuracy
2. LAMBDA Defense fights HTLVIII test, may sue Food and Drug Administration for unacceptably high false positive rates
COMMERCIAL: "Lust in the Dust"
3. Mariposa Foundation's Bruce Vogler discovers spermicide that eliminates HTLVIII on contact
4. Update on Supreme Court cases, National Gay Task Force Versus Oklahoma City schools
5. Interview with Tom Stoddard Legislative Director of New York Civil Liberties Union, discusses gay civil rights and Supreme Court cases
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
6. Future of gay civil rights
7. Anti-gay violence/harassment in Texas
COMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity with actor Mike Farrell
8. Minneapolis gym owner closes his business rather than abide by city's gay ordinances
9. Zelda Rubinstein works for Los Angeles AIDS education group, appears on posters and ads, includes clip from "Poltergeist"
COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store
10. Sports
11. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Christopher Collins, Cooperating Attorney with LAMBDA Legal Defense and Education Fund, returns and discusses HTLVIII test
12. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Media reports/current events/culture including Sammy Davis Junior clip and CBS HTVLIII coverage
COMMERCIAL: "Lust in the Dust"
2. Restaurant review
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazine
3. Sybil Bruncheon

[Air Date: 4/2/1985], April 1985

31142054869519box: 40, media: ID: 231.0626 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. New Hampshire votes against discriminatory blood bill
2. Several men press brutality charges against Chicago police department after a gar bar raid
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionals
3. Philadelphia police officers extort money from local gay bars, FBI sting operation reveals
4. Zelda Rubinstein ads
4. "The Times of Harvey Milk" wins academy award, includes clip from film and award show
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
5. New Jersey gay-discrimination
6. Texas senate proposes anti-gay employment discrimination bill, other Texas bills
7. New York State Gay and Lesbian lobbyists hire Desire Velarde as part-time lobbyist
8. New York State Lobby Day in Albany
9. As primary approaches, Carol Greitzer and David Rothenberg debate for City Council 3rd District position
10. Sports
11. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Bernard Granville, Insurance Broker, discusses comprehensive policies and misapprehensions
12. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Media reports/current events/culture
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazine
2. Dreamboys
COMMERCIAL: "Lust in the Dust"
3. Interview with Quentin Crisp and Terry Miller
COMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity
4. David Henderson in Dallas
5. Closing credits

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 32 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 149
[Air Date: 5/7/1985], May 7, 1985

31142054869527box: 41, media: ID: 231.0631 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Richmond Virginia hearings on gay rights
2. Man stabs and kills homosexual, claims self defense, 2nd degree murder
3. New South Wales, Australian Chief Medical Officer, seeks to close all bathhouses in the nation, believes it is a "breeding ground for AIDS"
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionals
4. Interview with Sue Li Bow, Director of Development for the Lesbian Rights Project, discusses family law and lesbian gay rights
5. Interview with Albuquerque's Common Bond president, Anne Doughty, discusses community center
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
6. Coming out
COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
7. Sports including clip
Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Gary MacDonald, Executive Director of the Federation of AIDS Related Organizations, discusses his organization
8. Closing Credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Media reports/current events/culture, includes Lawrence of Arabia clip and CNN news report on Gays and TV
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazine
2. Sybil Bruncheon
COMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity
3. Return to Sybil Bruncheon
COMMERCIAL: Arco Blancos resort, San Juan, Puerto Rico
4. Commercials with Sybil
COMMERCIAL: World of Video
5. Dr. Jim Serafini, Psychotherapist, discusses gay relationships, romance versus friendship

Scope and Content

Pride and Progress

5. Chicago Archbishop OKs gay civil rights
6. Andy Humm discusses Ed Koch's trip to Rome
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionals
6. Washington state highschooler harasses lesbians, starts school movement against them
7. Conference on gay seniors, Senior Action in a Gay Environment
8. Dallas news
8. Sports, interview with Ron Keel of the MCAA Bowling League
9. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Gary MacDonald, Executive Director of the Federation of AIDS Related Organizations, discusses funding
10. Closing credits

Scope and Content

Pride and Progress

[Air Date: 6/3/1985], June 1985

31142054869527box: 41, media: ID: 231.0635 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. United States Court of Appeals declares a constitutional right for gay privacy
2. Two Illinois gay rights bills voted down
COMMERCIAL: Brunch Buddies
3. Democratic National Committee decides to abolish lesbian and gay caucus
4. Political reaction to new NY gay judge and Chicago Archbishop's approval of gay civil rights
5. Two openly gay foster parents lose custody to children due to adoption publicity
6. Gay concentration camp memorial in Germany, first monument for homosexuals
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
7. Anita Bryant loses spot on television program after network receives complaints
8. Interview with Candida Piel, Co-Chair, Heritage of Pride, discusses Gay Pride Week and parade
9. Dallas news, includes clip of Lori Palmer, member of Oaklawn Council
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionals
10. Sports, includes clip of Greg Louganis
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
11. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Dr. Susan Trauss returns, discusses study of AIDS and its psychological impact
12. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Media report/current events/culture, includes clips of Joan Rivers and Matilda Krim
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazine
COMMERCIAL: Different Light Bookstore
COMMERCIAL: Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro, Islanders' Club
2. Sybil Bruncheon raffle and street interviews
3. Media: The Queen Mother
4. Psychotherapist, Dr. Jim Serafini, discusses drugs/alcohol and gay men
5. Closing credits

Scope and Content

Pride and Progress

1. Hollywood, Florida drops mandatory HTLV testing
2.New Orleans Archdioceses donates AIDS shelter for their 80 AIDS cases

4. Human Rights Campaign survey got gay and lesbian discrimination
5. Dallas, Texas report

Original Format: 3/4 in. Umatic

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 44 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 161
[Air Date: 7/29/1985] [3]--Connection, July 1985

31142054869527box: 41, media: ID: 231.0643 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Lesbian mother loses custody rights
2. Minneapolis health club discriminates against gay man
3. Hollywood city council mandates HTLVIII testing
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
4. Lesbian presidential candidate at University of Oregon wins election
5. Before stonewall
COMMERCIAL: NGTF Fund for Human Dignity: gay and lesbian disabled
6. Pittsburgh woman complains about gay organization's public phone listings
7. Mayor Koch addresses Greater Gotham Business Council, includes clip
8. Court upholds John McBride's will, includes over 100,000 dollar donation to gay civil rights
9. Brooklyn Public Library censorship
10. 1985 Gay Pride Parade, includes coverage
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
11. Sports
12. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Martin P. Levine, assistant professor of Sociology at Bloomfield College, discusses masculinity and gay sexuality
13. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Media reports/current events/culture, includes clips. Joan Rivers, Dr. Robert Jackson, Health Commissioner of South Carolina
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazine
2. Broadway, films, includes clip of "The Goonies"
COMMERCIAL: Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro, Islanders' Club
3. Sybil Bruncheon tours park
COMMERCIAL: NGTF Fund for Human Dignity with Abigail Van Buren "Dear Abby"
4. Sybil Bruncheon
COMMERCIAL: Arcos Blancos Resort, San Juan, Puerto Rico
5. Channel 13 celebrates Gay Pride Week with three documentaries during primetime: Silent Pioneers, The Word is Out, In the Best Interest of the Children, includes clips

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 45 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 162
[Air Date: 8/5/1985] [3]--Connection [4]--Rock Hudson, August 1985

31142054869527box: 41, media: ID: 231.0644 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Reagan administration seeks more AIDS funding
2. North Carolina blocks anti-gay legislation
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
3. HTLVIII confidentiality in Wisconsin
4. Johnson & Johnson orders a cease a desist on San Diego AIDS Project education campaign, Ban AIDS
5. HPA23, United States unfamiliar with drug, popular in France
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
6. Rock Hudson and AIDS
7. California court rejects lovers benefits claims
8. Refusal to hire or house Oklahoma sexual criminals, counts sodomy as crime
9. Gay Pride Parade coverage
COMMERCIAL: NGTF Fund for Human Dignity [with Judge Steven Lax, judge of Los Angeles Superior Court]
10. Sports
11. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Martin P. Levine returns, assistant professor of Sociology at Bloomfield College, discusses health and safe sex
12. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Sybil Bruncheon at Gracie Mansion
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazine
2. Ed Koch stands up Sybil Bruncheon
COMMERCIAL: Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro, Islanders' Club
3. Sybil Bruncheon reads letter
COMMERCIAL:["Your Testicles and You"]
4."If This Isn't Love" review, includes clip
COMMERCIAL: Arcos Blancos Resort, San Juan, Puerto Rico
5. Broadway Confidential: Cocoon, Prizzi's Honor
COMMERCIAL: World of Video
6. "Vampire Lesbians of Sodom"
7. Closing credits

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 47 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 164
[Air Date: 8/19/1985], August 1985

31142054869535box: 42, media: ID: 231.0646 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. R. Foster Winans, former Wall Street Journal reporter, receives prison sentences, judge grants his appeal to help AIDS victims for community service hours
2. State Farm Insurance extents joint owners and umbrella liability insurance to a San Francisco gay male couple
3. United States military charges man with homosexuality after he confidentially informs his naval doctor of his AIDS prognosis, AIDS discrimination
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
4. Elen Lauper, lesbian candidate for mayor in Phoenix, Arizona
5. Lesbian grandmother sues son-in-law for refusal to comply with visitation rights
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
6."poppers" amyl and butyl nitrates
7. Illinois Abbott Laboratories announces eventual release of accurate AIDS test
8. Pentagon delays mandatory HTLVIII-positive military lists amid controversy
9. 1985 gay pride rally coverage, includes Sybil Bruncheon
10. Sports
11. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Dr. Jeffrey Lawrence, Assistant Professor of Medicine at New York Hospital, Cornell, discusses AIDS research development
12. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Media reports/current events/culture, includes clip from "Divorce Court"
COMMERCIAL: Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro, Islanders' Club
2. Sybil Bruncheon in Central Park
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazine
3. Sybil Bruncheon and Daphne
COMMERCIAL: NGTF Fund for Human Dignity with actor Jack Albertson
4. Sybil Bruncheon
5. Interview with Larry Kramer, author of "The Normal Heart", discusses his play and AIDS awareness

Scope and Content

Pride and Progress

3. Interview with T.J. Howell, Committee to re-elect mayor

4. Political consultants say gay civil rights politicians will not benefit from their support
5. Washington bathhouse update
6. Georgia sodomy law controversy
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
7. John Cardinal O' Connor and his hospice for AIDS patients
8. New findings, tuberculosis may be linked to AIDS
9. AIDS number one killer of gay men in NYC, 1985
10. Minneapolis man wins AIDS descrimination case
11. Sports, interview with Neal Babitch, Different Spokes
12. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Dr. Jeffrey Lawrence, Assistant Professor of Medicine at New York Hospital, Cornell, discusses neutralizing antibodies

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 50 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 167
[Air Date: 9/11/1985], September 1985

31142054869535box: 42, media: ID: 231.0649 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Contents

Pride and Progress

News-highlights:

1. Pentagon announces dismissal for any upcoming military personnel with positive HTVLIII blood test

2. Gay Rights National Lobby honors David B. Goodstein with memorial fund

3. Gay religious movement, includes clip of 7th Biennial Dignity Convection, 1985

COMMERCIAL: AIDS Study at Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center

4. Boston City Councilor David Scondras testifies at the Democratic National Committee's fairness convention

5. New York Young Republicans recruits gay men and lesbians

6. Federation of Friends and Parents of Lesbians and Gays publishes booklet, "Read This Before Coming Out to Your Parents," interview with Amy Ashworth, Executive Director

COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp

7. Naval Corpsman receives dishonorable discharge because of his AIDS diagnosis

8. Women, minorities, and AIDS

9. New clinical studies for AIDS drug, compound S

9. Dionne Warwick, Stevie Wonder, and Gladys Knight record "That's What Friends Are For," proceeds go to AIDs research

COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper

10. Sports, includes clip

11. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Raymond Jacobs and William Shattls, AIDS Prevention Team members at Gay Men's Health Crisis, discuss 800 Men's study and AIDS risk reduction program

COMMERCIAL: GMHC Healthy Sex Workshops

12. Closing credits

The Right Stuff:

1. Sybil Bruncheon at sunglass stand

COMMERCIAL: GMHC Healthy Sex Workshops

2. Sybil Bruncheon window shops

COMMERCIAL: NGTF Fund for Human Dignity with actor Jack Albertson

3. Broadway Confidential, "The Mystery of Edwin Drood" and "National Lampoon's European Vacation," includes clip

COMMERCIAL: Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro, Islanders' Club

4. Interview with Henry Moch, Director of "Intelligence in Video"

COMMERCIAL: "Intelligence in Video" at The Limelight

5. Cabaret with Bradshaw Smith, includes clip of Bruce Hopkins

6. Closing

Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Nation's largest insurance companies try to access HTVLIII test results to determine applicants' insurability
2. Rhode Island governor signs pro-gay legislation into law
3. Massachusetts House of Representatives defeats a gay rights bill, AIDS scare
COMMERCIAL: NGTF Fund for Human Dignity with "Dear Abby" Abigail Van Buren
4. Racine, Wisconsin nurse loses job because of sexual orientation
5. Wisconsin QUEST Program starts housing program for low income gay and lesbian senior citizens
6. Episcopal church speaks out against AIDS anxiety
7. Federal government approves HPA23 for experimental use in the United States
8. Californian republican, congressman Robert Dornan speaks out against AIDS anxiety in The House of Representatives
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
8. Sports, includes clip
9. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Dr. Scott Croxson, Research Fellow, Beth Israel Medical Center, discusses AIDS related conflicts
10. Closing credits

1. Interview with Candido Mendes, Director of Gay Parade Day, includes coverage of parade
COMMERCIAL: Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro, Islanders' Club
2. Broadway Confidential, "After Hours," includes clip
COMMERCIAL: GMHC Healthy Sex Workshops
3. Cabaret Beat, includes clip of Bradshaw Smith

Pride and Progress

Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. The Pentagon's top doctor orders limited HTLVIII positive test result access, only civilian health officials can request
2. Thomas Stoddard, Legislative Director of The New York Civil Liberties Union, worries about confidentiality of military personnel HTLVIII test results
3. New York Governor Cuomo orders New York City bathhouse regulations
4. Reaction to Governor Cuomo's bathhouse regulation proposal
5. New York lobbyists and anti-gay AIDS bills
6. National Gay Rights Advocates challenge Nevada's sodomy laws with lawsuit
6. Texas Human Rights Commission raises funds to fight sodomy statutes
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
7. Senate proposes federal AIDS budget increase
8. Integrity, a gay and lesbian Christian organization, plans New York City AIDS memorial
9. Social security benefits proposal for ARC patients
10. Meridian, Mississippi police arrest 4 impersonators at local gay bar, 1902 rule prohibits cross-dressing
COMMERCIAL: Orientation '85, funded by The National Gay Task Force
11. Sports, includes clip
12. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Dr. Lawrence Mass discusses AIDS emergence and its spread

COMMERCIAL: The Monster
2. Sybil Bruncheon warms up
COMMERCIAL: AIDS hotline, New York AIDS Action
3. Sybil Bruncheon reads audience's questions
COMMERCIAL: World of Video

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 62 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 173
[Air Date: 12/3/1985], December 1985

31142054869535box: 42, media: ID: 231.0661 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. The American Federation of Labor CIO speaks in favor of gay rights
2. Vermont gay rights victory
3. David Axelrod, New York State Health Commissioner guest speaker at gay and lesbian synagogue
COMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity
4. District of Columbia reinstates revenue bonds to anti-gay Georgetown University
5. Dallas, Texas gay activist refuses sodomy statute oath
COMMERCIAL: Orientation '85, funded by The National Gay Task Force
6. AIDS hysteria, Potential bill criminalizes AIDS transmission
7. People's Republic of China protest against AIDS with travel restrictions and blood tests
8. Wayne Steinman, Civil Liberties Crisis Coalition, discusses AIDS hysteria
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
9. Sports, interview with Leslie Randolph, Ramblers
10. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Fran Peltz, Group Leader of Care Partners, discusses AIDS support
11. Closing credits

1. Sybil Bruncheon at Halloween celebration, Christopher Street
COMMERCIAL: AIDS hotline, New York AIDS Action
2. Sybil Bruncheon and Bill Baumer Halloween coverage
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
3. Cabaret Beat, includes Hal and David clip
4. Women Identified: Connie Kurtz, peer councilor, and Ruth Burman, mental health councilor, discuss the coming out process

Pride and Progress

3. Atlanta, city council amends constitution to protect against discrimination based on sexual orientation

4. Moral majority leader Jerry Falwell responds to phone harassment by cancelling phone service

5. New York City, fight against homophobic rhetoric of religious leaders

COMMERCIAL: Casio Pocket TV
6. Davis, California city council amends constitution to protect against discrimination based on sexual orientation

7. San Francisco, USPS apologizes for opening and returning mail of the Harvey Milk Lesbian and Gay Democratic Club

8. Chicago, gay father allowed to visit children without taking a court-mandated AIDs test

COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp

9. NYC, Coverage of Ed Koch signing the Gay Rights Bill into law

10. Event announcements

11. Gay Health Report: mental health in light of HTLV-III Antibody testing for AIDS

12. 1982 survey finds one-fourth of doctors are homophobic

13. National Association of Insurance Commissioners appoints two gay rights activists to a task force for policy-making

14. Sports Report

15. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Joey Leonte discusses GMHC-produced erotic comic books to promote safer sex

16. Closing credits

1. Summer reading recommendations from Different Light Bookstore

31142054869550box: 44, media: ID: 231.0682 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. American insurance associations donate $1.1 million to AIDS research
2. Estate of Rock Hudson sues Hudson's alleged ex-lover, Marc Christian
3. Gay and Lesbian Task Force co-director, Rosemary Kuropat, resigns
4. Coverage of Bowers v Hardwick
5. Idaho attempted to introduce a bill to prohibit teachers from discussing homosexuality in a positive light
6. Oklahoma's sodomy law ruled unconstitutional but only regarding non-gay sex
7. Outing closeted homosexuals who are publically anti-gay
COMMERCIAL: Commodore Plus 4
8. New Jersey wishes for Gay Rights Bill similar to New York City's
9. Gay Health Report
10. Discussion of apartment leases after AIDS-related deaths
11. Event announcement
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
12. Sports Report
13. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Interview with Joseph Foulon, a GMHC Hotline assistant, member of PWA Coalition, and an organizer of the NYC AIDS walk
14. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: E-Z Trim exercise equipment
2. Interview with Jaime Humberto Hermosillo and Marco Antonio Treviño, director and star of "Dona Herlinda and her Son"
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
3. Pop and Circumstance: music news, video clips
4. Sybil Bruncheon, tidbits
COMMERCIAL: The Monster

Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Catholic theologian Charles Curran warned by Vatican for support of homosexuals
2. Sacramento city passes Gay Rights Bill
3. Indiana legislature kills several anti-gay bills
4. Fundraiser held to repeal the Texas sodomy law
5. Possible AIDS vaccine's effect on search for a cure
COMMERCIAL: Commodore Plus 4
6. Rules governing the election of delegates in 1988 Democratic Convention changed to specifically include gays
7. Vermont rejects anti-discrimination move against gays by landlords
8. Gay Health Report: Study on course of HTLV infection, oral sex's riskiness, accommodation for gays visiting an Australia regatta
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
9. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Stash Santoro discusses GMHC's buddy program for those dying of AIDS
10. Sports Report, from Bowlmor Lanes
11. Closing credits

1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: E-Z trim exercise equipment
2. Cabaret Beat, clips from a performance
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
3. Interview with director Rosa von Praunheim about "A Virus Knows no Morals"
COMMERCIAL: "The Gascon" by John Colin Penford
4. Dramatic reading of "More Lies" by Hektor Munoz
COMMERCIAL: Jack Albertson for the Fund for Human Dignity
5. Review of the play "Immortal" by Felice Picano
COMMERCIAL: Koos Fashion store
COMMERCIAL: Michael Greer show announcement
6. Book Reviews: Gay/Lesbian Almanac by Jonathan Katz, Byron and Greek Love by Louis Crompton, Ganymede in the Renaissance by James Saslow, White Trash Cooking by Ernest Mickler

Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Proposed immigration ban for AIDS infected persons
2. Bunceton, Missouri, openly gay mayor Gene Ulrich elected to fourth term
3. Seattle, lawyers guild attempts to block anti-gay activists from repealing protective ordinance, Council of Churches supports gay civil rights
4. Andy Humm on censoring yourself and gay liberation

5. Interview with Connie Cohrt of the Greater Gotham Business Council
6. ICN, makers of Ribavirin, artificially inflated price of the drug in Mexico
7. Texas, first national AIDS hospital plans approved
8. National Cancer Institute renders AIDS virus harmless in the lab
9. Houston, Texas, council advises against health card proposal
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
10. Sports Report
11. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Doug Marcino, a volunteer in the Speaker's Bureau of GMHC's Education Department, on providing informational outreach about GMHC
12. Closing credits

31142054869550box: 44, media: ID: 231.0687 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Washington State, initiative proposed to make employing gays for jobs caring for children, the disabled, or senior citizens a gross misdemeanor; uses very discriminatory language to describe gays
2. Knoxville, Tennessee, church votes to allow Metropolitan Community Church to continue using its facility
3. Interview with co-coordinators of Heritage of Pride, Inc., discuss the forthcoming NYC Gay Pride March and Rally
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
4. Notre Dame prohibits gay/lesbian group from using radio station
5. Andy Humm on Catholic church's prohibitive stance on priests and sexuality
6. California extends equal employment protection to gays and lesbians
COMMERCIAL: Urban General Warehouse sale
7. Wisconsin AIDS task force moves for contact testing
8. Travel tips for people with AIDS
9. California governor approves selective testing for HTLVIII antibody in "high-risk" patients
10. Proposed AIDS insurance bill revised to prohibit testing by insurance companies
COMMERCIAL: NGTF Fund for Human Dignity
11. Sports Report
12. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Interview with Casey Donovan, sex-act performer, discussing safer sex and the proper use of condoms
13. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: E-Z Trim exercise equipment
2. Clips of Lyndon LaRouche discussing AIDS and Mark Fairchild discussing AIDS patients
3. Media Watch: interview with "Mandate" magazine editor, Freeman Gunther
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation featuring Jose Sarria
4. Interview with Phil Zwickler about "Rights and Reactions," a documentary film chronicling NYC's fight to pass the gay rights bill, with clips
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation, tape ends

31142054869550box: 44, media: ID: 231.0690 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Washington, DC, City Council passes bill prohibiting insurance companies from denying coverage to "high risk" persons or those with HTLVIII antibody
2. Providence, Rhode Island, equal rights amendment killed by constitutional conventional committee
COMMERCIAL: First Hand gay magazine
3. Senatorial candidate Phil Reed discusses a state gay rights bill
COMMERCIAL: Urban General Warehouse Sale
4. Event announcement
5. Andy Humm discusses relationships breaking up
6. Anchorage, Alaska, Mayor opposes amendment of equal rights ordinance to include homosexuals
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
7. Colorado, senate and house committees fail to vote on AIDS quarantine bill
8. US Senate raises AIDS research budget
9. AIDS becomes leading killer of men aged 30-44 and women aged 25-29 in New York City
10. Soldier is court-martialed after refusing to take a required HTLVIII antibody test
11. Two female high-schoolers allowed to attend prom together after a court order
COMMERCIAL: Arcos Blancos resort, Puerto Rico
12. Sports Report
COMMERCIAL: New York City Gay Men's Chorus
13. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Interview with Raymond Jacobs, discussing GMHC's erotic safer-sex movie "Chance of a Lifetime" and safer-sex workshops
14. Closing Credits
The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
Interview with Kevin Glines, playwright and co-founder of non-profit gay arts organization The Glines
COMMERCIAL: Body-mate exercise equipment
Interview with Stephen Holt, playwright, discusses his play "The Casting of Kevin Christian," reading from play
COMMERCIAL: Water Front Airways

Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Good effects of protective legislation for gays from insurance companies
2. New Jersey governor welcomes gays to the Republican Party

COMMERCIAL: Urban General Warehouse Sale

5. Toronto school board votes down a ban on discrimination based on sexual orientation
6. Cincinnati: Andy Humm discusses hosting a gay pride march in a conservative city
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
7. Wellington, NZ: Insurance companies screening "high risk" applicants for HTLVIII
8. Interview with Gary Miller, from the New York City Gay Men's Chorus, on an upcoming concert, with clips
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
9. Boston: Bill for the protection of confidentiality of HTLVIII positive persons sent back for a vote
10. AIDS Project Los Angeles lists donators names on billboards
11. 1st Annual San Francisco AIDS Bike-a-thon raises $250,000 for AIDS organizations, NYC AIDS Walk-a-thon raises $700,000

COMMERCIAL: Arcos Blancos resort, Puerto Rico
13. Sports Report, interview with Jim Skofield for the Gay Pride Run

2. Interview with Robert Chesley, author of the play, "Pigman," discussing safe sex as anti-eroticism
COMMERCIAL: Body-mate exercise equipment
3. Clips of Sybil Bruncheon speaking at GCN of Cincinnati, tape cuts off

Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Maine: Obscenity referendum to ban items of a sexual nature defeated
2. Massachusetts: Bill passed assuring privacy protection for HTLVIII positive persons
COMMERCIAL: Urban General Warehouse Sale
3. Interview with John Glines, discussing Stamp Out AIDS Project
4. Missouri: Anti-gay lawmaker fails in an attempt to ban gays from teaching in schools
5. Andy Humm discusses the 17th Anniversary of the Stonewall riots
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
6. Mayor Edward Koch attacked by homophobe at the Proclamation for Lesbian and Gay Pride Week, with clip
7. Adair Films loses its contract to make an AIDS documentary to a non-gay company
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
8. Hawaii: Governor signs measure ensuring confidentiality of those testing positive for sexually transmitted diseases
9. Lesbians at high risk for discrimination following the AIDS epidemic, despite being at lowest risk for the disease
10. Call for volunteers for a national study of drug treatments to treat AIDS/HTLVIII positive persons
11. Researchers grow AIDS virus in animal cells for the first time
12. Announcements about Gay Pride Weekend
COMMERCIAL: New York City Gay Men's Chorus
13. Sports Report
14. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Interview with Psychotherapist Michael Shernoff discussing eroticizing safer sex
15. Closing credits

1. Coverage of the Cincinnati Gay Pride Parade, includes clips of the march, the mayor reading equal rights amendment, GCN ensemble singing "Steppin' Out"

2. Interview with David Summers, cabaret singer and AIDS activist, regarding "Hero of My Own Life," with clip
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" magazine
3. Announcement of "Ten By Tennessee" production of Tennessee Williams' plays
4. Closing credits

Pride and Progress

5. Andy Humm discusses the concept of liberty and discrimination
COMMERCIAL: Urban General Warehouse Sale
6. House revises the codes prohibiting sexual assault to include men
7. Official Stamp Out AIDS stamps announced
8. HTLVIII antibody found in only 1% of infected persons' saliva
8. Yoga seminars offered to assist those with AIDS in keeping healthy, physically and mentally
9. Washington DC mayor signs into law a bill prohibiting insurance companies from denying coverage to those who test positive for the HTLVIII antibody

[Air Date: 7/15/1986], July 1986

31142054869568box: 45, media: ID: 231.0695 (Material Type: media)
Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. California, anti-gay Lyndon LaRouche is successful at getting an initiative on the ballot that would define AIDS as an infectious disease, allowing for quarantining, mandatory testing for suspected persons, and dismissal from public office
2. Coverage of protests against the Georgia sodomy laws in New York City on July 4th
COMMERCIAL: Urban General Warehouse Sale
3. Interview with Evan Wolfson from Lambda Legal Defense about Georgia sodomy laws and Bowers vs Hardwick
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
4. Andy Humm on the July 4th demonstration against the sodomy laws and liberation
5. July as "Make the President Aware Month"
6. Los Angeles, Spanish-language AIDS hotline funded by the government
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
7. Sports Report
8. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Interview with Bruce Patterson and Scott Jordan, discussing establishing a relationship in this anxious time and as a person with AIDS
8. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" magazine
2. Coverage of the New York City Gay Pride Parade by GCN Cincinnati, with clips
COMMERCIAL: Body Mate exercise equipment
3. Small items and clips of new bathing suit styles for men, tape cuts off
